result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gary M Kruckenberg was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Gary M Kruckenberg was found guilty of Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber to apply for work. Court recommends electronic monitoring. Credit for 2 days time served.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 06/06/16 or civil judgment.
Concurrent with: With count 1, with credit for 2 days time served. Huber privileges to apply for work. Court recommends electronic monitoring.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gary M Kruckenberg
Current: 5200 N. 45th St., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 12-29-2016)
Prior: 2848 West Wisconsin Avenue #102, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Order for ignition interlock exemptions and removing tital transfer stops; signed and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, for review. mag
Filed, Letter Asking for Exemption of Vehicles with Corresponding Order
Order GRANTING request to extend time to pay, signed and filed. Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. mag
LETTER FOR DEFENDANT REQUESTING PAYMENT PLAN. kl

Defendant Gary M Kruckenberg in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by Samuel R. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  The court ordered defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court recommends Electronic Monitoring.

*Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
*Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 24 months.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $1800.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges by 06-06-2016 or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The court ordered defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court recommends Electronic Monitoring.

*Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 06-06-2016 or civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Filed: Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

Defendant Gary M Kruckenberg in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing to Br 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary M Kruckenberg in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests 60 days for defendant to start and complete treatment program.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46.  This is to be the FINAL adjournment. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gary M Kruckenberg in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case held off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46.  Defense requests time for defendant to complete treatment. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS  immediatly upon leaving court.  Court orders supervision if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. IF DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid drivers license.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant will hire private counsel.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.

Defendant Gary M Kruckenberg in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
